title: Fix multi-language support — only Hindi works currently

requirements.text: Fix the language switching functionality so that all 7 supported Indian languages (Hindi, English, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Bengali, Marathi, or whichever are defined in translations.ts) work correctly when selected via the LanguageSelector component. Currently only Hindi renders translated content; all other languages fall back to incorrect or missing strings.

quotes: only hindi is working other languages are not working

acceptanceCriteria: Selecting any language from the LanguageSelector dropdown updates all visible UI text to the correct translation for that language.
The t() helper in LanguageContext correctly resolves translation keys for every language defined in translations.ts.
Translations are persisted in localStorage and restored correctly on page reload for all languages.
The SOS overlay, helplines page, safety tips page, for boys page, and all navigation labels update text when the language is switched.
No language falls back to Hindi strings unless Hindi is explicitly selected.

requirements.text: Audit translations.ts to ensure every language's translation object is complete — all keys defined in the Translation interface must have non-empty string values for every supported language. Fill in any missing or placeholder entries.

quotes: only hindi is working other languages are not working

acceptanceCriteria: Every key in the Translation interface has a corresponding non-empty translated string for each of the 7 supported languages.
No language object is missing keys relative to the Translation interface definition.
No key returns undefined or an empty string for any supported language.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/ (immutable paths).
Do not change the set of supported languages — only fix the existing ones.
nonGoals: Adding new languages beyond those already defined.
